content: Hey crafters welcome again today we are going to set our table last time we
built the table this time we're going to set it so let's go to the our crafting
table and set our miniature table you
you guys know I'm a big fan of the wooden shapes and I always have these
woodsies on hand this is these are the circular shapes and they're all
different sizes I also have some a rectangle and triangle shapes and the
idea for this kind of sparked from these small circular shapes so here's some
pieces I'm going to use to set the table with these are some just very small
pre-cut circles and they came in that pack of circles that I showed and those
are perfect I think I'll be perfect for plates but what I want to do is to add a
little bit of food to the plate I also got this bowl shape let's see if
I can show you there which I think will be really nice for kind of like a
serving bowl so what I'm gonna do is I'm going to take my small glue gun and I
will kind of squirt it a little bit on the plate and then I can use then I can
paint that up I'll paint these all black and I can paint that up and it'll look
like there's food on the plate okay so now the bowl
I want to squirt into the hole in the bowl and it'll build up on the outside
so what I'll probably do is let that dry and then I'll build up some more on the
on the top of that so okay so now we'll just finish up the plates and we'll
paint that flat black and then come back and finish it up
so here I've applied the hot glue to all the bowls and plates and they're hard to
see because they're I've base painting them with the black spray paint you can
also see that I have a few square platters and you'll see those better and
detail as I add apply paint to them here I have the the serving bowls and
platters all finished I used a burnt umber to paint everything
first after it was spray painted black then I used a light I use a lighter
brown for some of the highlights on the platters and the bowls and you can use
white and mix it to the to the paint that usually I think I use moccasin
Brown lighter brown to do that and then you can see on the trays themselves I
have some meat and veggies and I just used varying shades of green and varying
shades of a reddish brown now if you don't have a lot of paints in your
collection you can always use white to water or to lighten colors you already
have and apply highlights here are the smaller plates and this was a very
similar method you can see I have a little bit of meat and veggies on the
plate there I just painted part of it with the reddish brown color and
partnered with the green color then you can see the plates I painted them a
gunmetal so they were I wanted to look like pewter so I think that came out
really nice this next picture here details the process of putting the
setting the table basically so the tables themselves are not actually the
actual tables that I showed in the previous video they are pieces of
cardstock cut exactly the same size of the table and then I painted them with
the same technique as the table so if you haven't seen that make sure you
watch that bid and now I'm going to apply the table settings to these
cardstock discs the first setting here has a platter in the center and then for
four plates around it and I wanted to have varied setup so I did another one
with the serving bowl in the center with the plates around it and this is a table
for two hungry adventures I've got two plates with the serving tray and the
bowl now all I did to apply these to this cardboard disc was just use some
white glue underneath and just stick them right on oh they have set the table
for me rather if two hungry young why do you have to be in such a pig everywhere
we go they don't call me Roderick too hungry for nothing so here we go here's
our table I think it looks really great let me give you a look see there's our
table with the setting on top now it's just a disk so it slides off
the top so if you want you can have the table and then not have to have the
setting on it or you can just pop that right on top and you're good to go
so I like this I like this technique because you can switch between tables
you don't have to make one set of tables with width setting and food on them and
another without so I think it's pretty cool idea one thing I didn't do in the
video that you can also do is you could use beads I found that you can use small
beads for our cups and I haven't shown this on the on the table but that's
something you could do too so yeah the disc I just painted that you can see
exactly the same as the table okay so it just perfectly matches the top of the
table now the reason I didn't do use magnets on this as they were just they
weren't they would make the table too thick and so you know I didn't want
sitting so high I wanted it to sit directly on the table and this is just a
fairly thin piece of cardstock you can see there so there we go there's our
table setting and I'll see you next time on the craft hey guys I hope you liked
the bit and found it helpful if you did like the vid make sure you give me a
like if you would like to join more groups that discuss this type of
crafting make sure you join the DMS craft forum and I have a new Facebook
page which both links are below in the video description so keep on crafting
hey guys watch next time when I show you how to make a heart for your hovel
